dialogues.CAVANAUGH:
[1]You showed me yours. I'll show you mine. 
[2]He's just some gambler. Lives completely off the grid. No bank account. No credit cards. No previous record. So why'd he do it? 
[3]Must be a wacko. He'd never met the victim. No connection whatsoever. And in fifteen months, why haven't you caught him? 
[4]You saw. He's got eyes in the back of his head. He can see around corners. I even had him in custody once, and he disappeared. Must be very embarrassing. 
[5]And what is it you want him for? Questioning. 
[6]About? Stuff that hasn't happened yet. 
[7]Well, I guess Homeland Security trumps liquor store murder. How can I help? 
[8]Yes, ma'am. 
[9]What, you think he's got some kind of radar? 
[10]And Area 51 would explain my missing tennis shoes. But that doesn't mean they're on a flying saucer. 
[11]I'd call your proof a little iffy. 
[12]Let's say I'm not an idiot... 
[13]Then what? 
[14]I know. 
[15]I say we get the whole department up here and bust his ass. And by that time, his ass'll be long gone. 
[16]Then why won't he see through your trap? Let's try this one more time. 
[17]You haven't been chasing him for three years. Miss Cooper. 
[18]And that's when we go in. You still don't get it. This has to be clear to your whole army. And yours. -- After she comes out and we lock down the cabin...We don't do anything. We wait. But if he's already trapped...? 
[19]That kinda makes sense. 
[20]When is that? That's the point. We want to delay "eureka" for as long as possible. So by the time he sees trouble and decides to waltz away... He's already been in the trap for hours. 
[21]What's taking so long? 
[22]We stand pat till notified. Don't make a sound. 
[23]We've got movement in the canyon. Where are you? 
[24]We tried it your way. Go for it. But I want him alive. 
[25]Boys, now it's our turn. 
[26]Is this a joke? 
[27]This is your last warning.
dialogues.IRV:
[1]What are you doing back here? 
[2]Idiot. 
[3]This is what you get from two packs a day. But you quit ten years ago. 
[4]It was already too late. I just didn't know it. 
[5]Look where you're headed, pal. The big decisions are over before you even realize you made `em. Any idea where he might be going? 
[6]You want my advice? Get yourself a good lawyer and turn yourself in. 
[7]Make you a secret agent. Don't laugh. They strap me in a chair and make me watch the news. 
[8]Dan Rather or Peter Jennings? 
[9]In that case, you've gotta leave the country. 
[10]What? 
[11]Cris? 
[12]You gotta go? 
[13]Then what the hell are you waiting for? 
[14]Who? 
[15]Then find somebody else! 
[16]What's so special about this one? 
[17]I thought you were shooting blanks. 
[18]I don't mean to be indelicate, my friend, but how do you know the little bastard is yours? 
[19]Your thing? 
[20]I still don't understand why you never got that fixed. She's here. 
[21]In that case, you've gotta leave the country. 
[22]What? 
[23]Cris? 
[24]You just got here. 
[25]You're gonna need it. You're the only one I could trust. Ever. 
[26]I don't suppose you've discovered any last minute escape for me? 
[27]It's okay. It's okay...Now I can relax.
dialogues.BAINES:
[1]We're strictly internal. 
[2]Does Wisdom know about this? 
[3]What is it? 
[4]If you say so. 
[5]Unnoticeably. 
[6]We could just do this the old- fashioned way. 
[7]Damn. Fifty men might not be enough. 
[8]He's crossed over into Maxwell Gorge. 
[9]He's heading this way. Cavanaugh! We've got a fox hunt going in Maxwell Gorge, right beneath the stakeout. Throw everybody into it! We need to overload him! 
[10]Why these? 
[11]He doesn't miss a beat. 
[12]He's driving right into it... 
[13]Sometimes looking one step ahead isn't enough. 
[14]What's the plan? 
[15]Don't be stupid! He knows what you'll do! 
[16]I'm issuing infrared to all my men. We should have a fix in a few minutes. 
[17]And the dogs are useless. 
[18]We're moving her. 
[19]You won't believe this. He's got Ferris. 
[20]I don't know, but he's on his way to the front door. They want instructions. 
[21]Then how are we going to stop him? 
[22]You're sure about this?
dialogues.CrIS:
[1]And "we" is...? Homeland Security. Now if you would, please look at the monitor and tell us what you see, say, five minutes from now. Are you there yet? Surfers. Good. Now can you move ahead ten minutes. Ants crawling up a tree. Excellent. Can you get to 1900 hours? 
[2]Just the check. "The future ain't what it used to be." Ever hear that expression? 
[3]It's a joke, but it's true. The future changes every time you look at it. Because you looked at it. 
[4]Cause once you see it, you're different. 
[5]Maybe just a little. 
[6]And that changes everything else. 
[7]It's got something to do with quantum physics. That's why I stay away from roulette and craps. It only takes a millionth of an ounce to change a roll. Just placing a different bet can throw things off. 
[8]I've got other rules, too. I don't play against people, like at poker. Only against the house.

[162]To whatever happens next. 
[163]Why? 
[164]Late? 
[165]I do now. 
[166]I have no idea. Unless...But that still doesn't explain... 
[167]Liz, I really did have this problem. I wasn't lying to you. 
[168]But this is good. This is amazing. I want this baby more than anything. 
[169]For both of us. 
[170]You lying bitch! You betrayed me! 
[171]Liz, please, I love you. 
[172]Let me talk to you for one minute. I won't hurt you, I promise. 
[173]The man I killed was there to rob the store. He was going to panic and shoot five innocent people. 
[174]Because I saw them die. 
[175]Yes. 
[176]Not "might"! Those people died! - They just hadn't died yet. 
[177]Once. 
[178]That's why I don't go out much. So I won't be there to see. 
[179]If they catch me, they'll put me in a cell without a trial, and they'll never let me out. They do that, you know. 
[180]There's one decent path. But if we're gonna stay on it, I need you to do exactly what I say. 
[181]Will you give me one chance? One chance in exchange for a miracle? 
[182]A few steps on, your robe will get caught on a thornbush. You won't be able to get unstuck. Ferris and a tough guy will come help you. She'll say, "You've done your country a great service." 
[183]Be unpredictable. Surprise works to my advantage. - And read this when you're safe. 
[184]Bet on it. She's coming now. We stay put. Tell them. 
[185]moves erratically, presciently, in bursts, dodging the streaking spots of glare.  StakEOUT SITE  Liz is drinking coffee next to Rick's police car. Ferris approaches, coldly knowing.  
[186]Believe me now? 
[187]Where were you going? 
[188]I'll check on our ride. Yeah... No, the jet's not sold...I'm here with him now...Of course, he's pissed...I can ask. He wants to know how soon the jet can be ready. I'll wait until eight o'clock. But if he's not there, I'm taking off without him. It's arranged. But we have to get to the North Vegas airport by eight. 
[189]Right now I'm just trying to stay alive. 
[190]Just the opposite. I never take chances. 
[191]Did the doctors ever say why you couldn't have kids? 
[192]What's that? 
[193]Except you're not. And neither am I. We're different, that's all. We just had to find the right match. 
[194]Oh shit. Oh no. What is it? 
[195]I blew it. 
[196]
[197]Still on the rock. Looks up and sees a cable being lowered from the helicopter. He looks around? Is there another way out? Out of choices, he reaches for the cable. Misses! Loses his balance. Flails. At the last second, he steadies himself.  He wants to live.  The cable dangles back into range.  Cris grabs it.  The cable is hooked to A PAIR OF HANDCUFFS.     
[198]Why does everybody have amnesia but me? 
[199]Don't let them know you're pregnant. You don't have to raise him. But at least let him be born. Can you do that? It might be the only chance either of us gets. 
[200]I'll get us out of here. We can still make the plane. Are you out of your mind? Did you ever play chicken before? 
[201]"From now on, Cris, the bullets are real." 
[202]I'm going. No need for a hotfoot. The floor is electrified. He must have tried resisting and foreseen the result. 
[203]Why? Why not? 
[204]I know what happens. Tell us. 
[205]You tie me down and never let me out. That's only because you won't cooperate. 
[206]Because you're trying to force me. Work with us, Cris, and you can be a hero. Fight us, and things will get worse and worse. Now sit in the chair. One. Two. Three. 
[207]I don't believe you. 
[208]Don't get too attached to your arms and legs. Don't. 
[209]He hasn't got the balls. 
[210]I'd say you have way too much. 
[211]Give me your keys. 
[212]If I see you, I'll kill her. 
[213]"We got off on the wrong foot." 
[214]"all been a big misunderstanding." 
[215]"We've never meant you any harm." 
[216]I guess you're a better liar than I am. 
[217]It'll never happen. 
[218]When are they going to give up? After you're dead? 
[219]To a gang of murderers? 
[220]What's about to happen...you've brought it on yourselves. 
[221]I'm planning on it. 
[222]Get out! 
[223]I guess... 
[224]They didn't explain. They were trying to force me. They were gonna make me a slave. 
[225]Liz? Where are you going? To the doctor. 
[226]But I have conditions. 
[227]Liz... Come back to bed. 
[228]I can't. - I have to go. 
[229]There's something I have to do. Something you'd want me to do. And I can't put it off any longer. 
[230]Liz, it's not like that. I searched for you for a long time. I want to be with you forever. 
[231]But a lot has happened since then. 
[232]We're going to have a child. 
[233]I don't expect you to believe me. But when you do find out, remember that we came together for a reason. That this wasn't just...one night. It was a special chance for both of us. 
[234]I'm not...I'm taking the long way around. 
[235]And I looked for a happy ending... But this was the best I could do. 
[236]I wouldn't be surprised. Mr. Johnson, we meet at last. 
[237]I wasn't ready till now. 
[238]"The future ain't what it used to be." Ever hear that expression? 
[239]It's a joke, but it's true. The future changes every time you look at it. Because you looked at it. Cause once you see it, you're different. And that changes everything else.
dialogues.CORRIDOR:
[1]Empty. A door opens. Cris steps out into the hall carrying the backpack and a foot stool. He stays close to a wall, steps on the foot stool, and spray-paints over the lens of a surveillance camera.  
[2]SOLDIER PETE and SOLDIER BRIAN charge into an empty corridor and begin their search for Cris.  A door slams open, bashing Pete in the face. Cris breaks his shooting arm, grabs his M-16, hides behind the door, and sprays bullets low, hitting Brian in the shins. He runs to Brian, breaks his shooting arm, takes his rifle. Drags Brian and Pete into an open room. Tapes their mouths.  
[3]SOLDIER JASON and THREE TROOPS are on the way, each with a 
[4]Emerging into the hallway, Cris looks down at the end of the hall and sees two MP's falling to the floor, wounded.  Cris wraps electrical tape around the door handle and a pipe on the wall, sealing the room shut, then turns and maces the last of the dogs.  
[5]Cris, on the run, encounters CRACK SHOT - not where he was seen in prevision. Crack Shot reaches for his gun. Cris breaks his arm before Crack Shot can fire.  
[6]Wisdom and Ferris, walking.  
[7]As they pass under him, Ferris sees the sniper above. Cris takes aim at an empty space and fires just as a soldier charges from hiding and absorbs the bullet as if deliberately catching it with his body.     
[8]Cris charges out of the stairwell, shooting without hesitation - forward, left, right, back - efficiently targeting Security Police in the precise order of their imminent readiness to fire at him. For each bullet, one soldier dies.  Wisdom's voice comes over the P.A. System.   Cris and Ferris keep moving.   Cris marches right up to the Interrogation Room where Wisdom holds Liz prisoner, using Ferris as a human shield.   Cris opens the door to the room, revealing Wisdom, Ferris, and thirty Security Police and MP's - who take aim at him and fire. Cris gets chopped to pieces.   Cris crouches on the floor outside the Interrogation Room, reaches up and opens the door. He gets off a shot at Wisdom, who lives long enough to put a bullet in Liz's heart.   Cris uses Ferris as a shield, gets off a burst of shots at Wisdom, killing him instantly.    But a Soldier at Wisdom's side puts a bullet in Liz's heart -- then the thirty Security personnel blast Cris and Ferris to pieces.   
[9]Now empty. Cris runs for it. Dives.
dialogues.FeRRIS:
[1]Call me, like they did. And try to hold him till I get here. Yes, ma'am. Nice looking guy. I guess. Maybe she's in cahoots. He's beaten six dealers in a row. You're sure he's not counting? We've got five decks in the shoe. And he wins more off the top than the bottom. Moves a lot from table to table. Keeps his stacks short. 
[2]Give me a headset. I'm going down there. He's heading toward... the Ipanema Grill. 
[3]You! I just need to talk to you! 
[4]Homeland Security! You were right. This guy is a lot more than lucky. At least now I know he exists. Jeannie, I have to see him right away. He's on with Washington. We just went on Code Orange. What's the threat? 
[5]I need six men to bring him in. 
[6]Come on, Eric, you saw it. We're flying blind and he's got radar. 
[7]You bastard. 
[8]Look, we analyzed what this ability would look like if it existed. 
[9]I went screening for it in a highly scientific way. And now I've identified someone who matches all the indicators. So the next obvious step is to... Let me do my job! - Christ! Don't you ever quit? 
[10]No. I've got a country to protect. 
[11]Terry? Terry! - I know you've got your hands full but I was wondering if you might be able to spare a few warm bodies for an outside operation. 
[12]That's why I need your people. Everybody else is assigned. 
[13]He suggested it. 
[14]Depends how helpful you are. Oh, I know everything about him. 
[15]I need to speak to him alone. 
[16]Why'd he come back to Vegas? 
[17]One step ahead of the game. Always. Is there some place we can speak privately? 
[18]You're wasting your life, Cris. You have the most amazing talent, and you're running from it. 
[19]Now if you say that man in the liquor store was going to shoot five people, I believe you. Why else would you kill a stranger? 
[20]But no good deed goes unpunished, eh? 
[21]And that's how it's going to be in this world. People will either hate you or want to exploit you. 
[22]I can fix your legal problems. More importantly, I can give you a chance to use your gift. 
[23]I'll be honest with you, Cris. That's not an option. Your country needs you. And if we don't grab you, somebody else will. 
[24]I'd like you to come with me for some testing. Would you be willing to do that? 
[25]Where are you going? 
[26]Shit! Cavanaugh! 
[27]I need him alive, Cavanaugh. Even if he resists. 
[28]Tell them. You'll never catch him. He knows what you're gonna do to him. 
[29]That's very helpful information. Medium coffee, black, and a glazed. 
[30]Long enough to know we're not gonna catch him by surprise. 
[31]Interesting idea. It'd explain a whole lot. 
[32]In this case, it does. 
[33]Look, from your own experience, this guy can't be punched, shot, surprised, captured, or confined. So either he's got something special, or you're an idiot. 
[34]And I'm not saying you are. 
[35]We've got to think like he does. We've got to think ahead. 
[36]You know you're very sexy when you're ruthless. 
[37]My guy's got a flashlight. We just need to bring him in. 
[38]This one first. 
[39]A trap for somebody who can see the future. 
[40]And then these. 
[41]Stay in the car. If he sees your shadow, he won't take the bait. We hear you. I'm serious. This guy can smell your farts before you even eat the beans. Miss, I won't even think about beans. Sounds like a crock to me. 
[42]Agent Ferris. 
[43]That's why I came to you. 
[44]Even his best friend says he'll never turn himself in. - At this stage, there's only one way to keep him from self-destructing. 
[45]But silently, right? 
[46]Gentlemen, try to think like him. - If the plan is to go in right after he's trapped, he'll see it coming and he'll slip away before he's trapped... Like he's always done. How does your plan change anything? At least he won't hear it when the trap closes. 
[47]And if he doesn't know he's trapped, he can't foresee knowing he's trapped. 
[48]The eureka moment is when he realizes he's been trapped. 
[49]Voila. 
[50]Women hate good-looking men. Rejecting them makes us feel powerful. And that's more important than love? 
[51]No. But she doesn't really love him. Liz... Liz? 
[52]Surprise. 
[53]Okay. Wait for my signal. 
[54]What's she waiting for? 
[55]I want him alive. Tell them. And the Feds want him alive. We need to get to him first. 
[56]You've made a very stupid mistake. 
[57]But I've profiled him for months. And I can tell you this: he doesn't love anybody. How could he? To him, we're not even human. 
[58]We're the characters in a videogame, and he's the player with the joystick. We say our lines, and he practices his moves until we do what he wants. 
[59]I underestimated him. 
[60]By a lot. 
[61]Change of plans, everybody. 
[62]Try to kill him. Use everything you've got. 
[63]No, it's an order. Don't get emotional here. 
[64]There's only one way to beat this man. He's got to see his own death, and not just maybe. He's got to see himself die again and again and know it's inescapable. And then, maybe, he'll surrender. And if he doesn't? 
[65]That'll be his choice. And he was no use to us anyway. 
[66]Somehow we've got to bring him down to our level. Got any ideas? 
[67]I'm workin' on it. 
[68]Move in fast. Keep him moving. Don't let him rest. 
[69]Don't give him time to look ahead. That's the key. 
[70]Cavanaugh, get all your men into town. Cavanaugh? Tell them. He's dead. Crashed. 
[71]You take command of the chase. Have cars block these intersection. 
[72]Get in the chopper. 
[73]Come to momma. 
[74]Stay after him. Keep the pressure on. 
[75]I need your vehicle. 
[76]Playing chicken. 
[77]But so do I. And for once, that makes us even. 
[78]Total focus. No doubts or decisions.  
[79]Watches through binoculars as Cris snaps one cuff around his wrist -- and waits. She shouts into her radio.  
[80]Cuffs on both wrists. Leave him if he doesn't. 
[81]I don't want to find out. Both wrists! 
[82]I was wrong about one thing. He is capable of love. 
[83]I only ask one thing from you. Give me a chance to earn your trust. I did, and you failed. 
[84]Then give me another chance. You get `em all the time. 
[85]This game was different. He knew I wouldn't flinch. What's new with the Code Orange? 
[86]Electromagnets. 
[87]Not possible with him. 
[88]Cris, please step into the next room. 
[89]Cris, we'll be firing at you with live ammo. Are you ready? You're shooting your secret weapon? 
[90]Now we are going to use live ammo. 
[91]I promise you, he won't be hit. 
[92]He's almost impossible to shoot, hit, surprise, capture, or contain. 
[93]Be my guest. How do you know it's prevision? Maybe he's reading minds. 
[94]No minds to read. The guns are aimed automatically by infrared. What other tricks can he do? Please step into the next room. 
[95]We're still in a Code Red if I'm not mistaken. 
[96]He's almost never had to face consequences. Cris, are you ready to get in the chair? 
[97]We need information, right? 
[98]Leave him there. We'll start again when he recovers. 
[99]Simple. We make him watch the news and tell us about it. 
[100]I don't know. But I suspect we can increase his range with practice. Especially if we restrict his future to only watching news. Then he'll be like a timescope. 
[101]This is just for starters. You want to stage a pre-emptive strike, he can tell you if you'll hit the target and whether they hit back and what went wrong. And you can do this over and over until you get it perfect before you begin. And all he's ever done with it is a little gambling and securities fraud? I know, it's amazing; but he's not ambitious. Damn, how will we control this guy when he figures out what he's capable of? We control him now. We just have to keep it that way. 
[102]Can we deal with your sexual insecurities at another time? 
[103]I told you, he doesn't read minds. He sees the results. 
[104]Don't give him time. Send them in now. 
[105]If there's one soft heart, one slow shooter, he'll know it. Don't worry. I caught him once; I'll catch him again. 
[106]Get him a local. You asked for these as soon as they were ready. 
[107]Not now. You might want to check this result. How pregnant? A few days. 
[108]This is getting interesting. We have a mating pair. 
[109]We don't actually have to do anything. We just have to decide to do something...unthinkable. 
[110]Threats don't count. When he foresees that you actually did kill her, that she's dead... He won't let it happen. - He'll come to us. Surrender. And she'll live. 
[111]But it only works if we're not bluffing. Because he'll know. 
[112]He's getting away. 
[113]You understand what's at stake here? We're playing for the future. Not just what happens next, but what the future is. What the rules are. 
[114]If one man will know it and control it -- and have power over the rest of us. Or if we'll have power over him. 
[115]If you want, I'll pull the trigger. 
[116]I'll join you in a minute. I need to take care of some details. 
[117]This is Ferris. I'll need a chopper tanked up and ready. 
[118]We'll find out, won't we? 
[119]God, you're remarkable. 
[120]I wish you had a little more sense of duty. 
[121]You know what our problem is? 
[122]It's really... 
[123]Exactly. 
[124]It sounds so insincere when you say it. 
[125]You know what I'm going to say next? 
[126]My door will be open. We can start from scratch. 
[127]The magic word is cooperate. That's all we've ever wanted to hear from you. 
[128]I see you got our message. 
[129]Where did you get this number? I want to cooperate. 
[130]That's music to my ears. 
[131]I'm sure we can work something out. 
[132]We don't have time to waste. Maybe you could start by telling me how your talent works.
dialogues.Randy:
[1]You still care for me, I know it. 
[2]You still care for me, I know it. 
[3]approaches RICK, a young LOCAL POLICEMAN who's not the sharpest knife in the drawer.        Ext. church - DAY  Paul and Janice are chatting with Cris and Liz.    Cris grows distracted. Out the corner of his eye, he sees a SPORTS CAR gunning it down the street, passing a SUNDAY DRIVER to beat a red light. At that moment, a kid misses a catch and a BASEBALL rolls into a street, where a twenty-ish WOMAN JOGGER runs over to get it, just as the sports car passes the Sunday driver, sees the jogger, and skids, forcing A BUS to swerve and plow into a GROUP OF PEOPLE standing at the corner.
dialogues.INTERROGATION ROOM:
[1]While the Guards stand on alert, Liz sits in a chair and discovers a piece of paper on a side table, placed exactly where her hand has come to rest. On the paper, in pencil, a square with a square cross within. She flips over the note. It reads, "GO CRAZY!"  She considers, then SCREAMS as loud as she can while running around wildly.  
[2]The MP's force Liz into a chair behind a desk.  
[3]Liz anxiously checks the clock. 5:43 and still no Wisdom. Then the door opens. And Wisdom enters.  They study each other, neither knowing the other's plans. She glances aside at the clock.  
[4]Wisdom and Liz. He watches the clock. Now she's afraid.  
[5]Wisdom keeps his gun aimed at Liz's head as he watches the clock: 5:55 PM.   
[6]Wisdom holds Liz at arm's length with his gun pointed at her head. Watching the clock count up to 6:00 PM. It's 5:59:41/ /42/43...  
[7]Wisdom watches the clock count advance. 5:59:55/56/57...  
[8]As Wisdom prepares to the pull the trigger, the bomb explodes in a giant cataclysm.  Smoke and dust  Roiling. Opaque. Then clearing.  The center of the building  is gone. A jagged raw atrium extends several stories down and up.  To the side, on a narrow ledge of floor extending from a wall...crouches Liz. The only person remaining. She has survived by inches. Very precise.  As she recovers from the blast, a door opens behind her. Cris appears, extends a hand and helps her from her perch.  Ext. North vegas airport - night  A private jet warms up on the tarmac.  ext. Private jet - night  Cris and Liz bound up the entry steps, exhausted but elated.
dialogues.Guy:
[1]You burned through your stash already? 
[2]Ahh. 
[3]Well, I hope you don't mind. I called Neal to let him know you're here. 
[4]You say everything's inevitable, so I guess I did. 
[5]Then you're aware that Neal is in a serious cash crunch and could lose it all. 
[6]Neal's got it all worked out. He'll fly you out of the country on his jet. Put you up in style. He pays taxes, totally legal. You get cash, squeaky clean. Half the net. When your share hits fifty mil, you can say "finito"...and it's over. 
[7]You need us, asshole! The Law is breathin' down your neck! 
[8]But why live that way? 
[9]What do you give a shit as long as you get what you want? 
[10]The jet'll be sold in a week. Then there goes your ticket out. 
[11]I've got a little problem with the IRS. Think I could get some relief? 
[12]And another thing, no woman ever turns him down, I'm serious. Mainly because he only propositions the ones he knows'll say yes, which is most of `em anyway. But does that make him happy? No. Says he's bored. Never surprised. Has to watch himself die over and over again. 
[13]Didn't say, but I'm guessin' it's this friend who's dying. An old fart who took him in when he was strung out on drugs. - He's an orphan, ya know. Been on the road since he was ten.
dialogues.CaVANAUGH:
[1]You showed me yours. I'll show you mine. 
[2]He's just some gambler. Lives completely off the grid. No bank account. No credit cards. No previous record. So why'd he do it? 
[3]Must be a wacko. He'd never met the victim. No connection whatsoever. And in fifteen months, why haven't you caught him? 
[4]You saw. He's got eyes in the back of his head. He can see around corners. I even had him in custody once, and he disappeared. Must be very embarrassing. 
[5]And what is it you want him for? Questioning. 
[6]About? Stuff that hasn't happened yet. 
[7]Well, I guess Homeland Security trumps liquor store murder. How can I help? 
[8]Yes, ma'am. 
[9]What, you think he's got some kind of radar? 
[10]And Area 51 would explain my missing tennis shoes. But that doesn't mean they're on a flying saucer. 
[11]I'd call your proof a little iffy. 
[12]Let's say I'm not an idiot... 
[13]Then what? 
[14]I know. 
[15]I say we get the whole department up here and bust his ass. And by that time, his ass'll be long gone. 
[16]Then why won't he see through your trap? Let's try this one more time. 
[17]You haven't been chasing him for three years. Miss Cooper. 
[18]And that's when we go in. You still don't get it. This has to be clear to your whole army. And yours. -- After she comes out and we lock down the cabin...We don't do anything. We wait. But if he's already trapped...? 
[19]That kinda makes sense. 
[20]When is that? That's the point. We want to delay "eureka" for as long as possible. So by the time he sees trouble and decides to waltz away... He's already been in the trap for hours. 
[21]What's taking so long? 
[22]We stand pat till notified. Don't make a sound. 
[23]We've got movement in the canyon. Where are you? 
[24]We tried it your way. Go for it. But I want him alive. 
[25]Boys, now it's our turn. 
[26]Is this a joke? 
[27]This is your last warning.
dialogues.Liz:
[1]Yeah, actually I do. 
[2]What business is it of yours? 
[3]Aw Christ! Look what you've done! 
[4]Yeah, you are.

[7]How's that?

[39]I'm not yours anymore, asshole! Baby, I've made a terrible mistake, and I just want to undo all the... Let go! 
[40]Get out of here! Get out! 
[41]Stop it, Randy! Stop it! 
[42]Get out of here! Get out! 
[43]Oh God, I'll take you to the emergency room. 
[44]God, I hate that bastard...Will somebody get some ice! 
[45]Are you kidding? You stood up for me. 
[46]Sorry it's so cold in here. The heater's broken. 
[47]I really should've left him a long time ago. God knows he deserved it. 
[48]Cause I don't leave. I never have. My boyfriends always left me. 
[49]I get attached to people, and then I'll put up with anything. 
[50]Sit in the light. 
[51]I never minded that I was the more devoted one. Somebody's gotta be more this or more that. 
[52]But they never appreciate it, that you're there for them. 
[53]They just try and get away with more and more, and figure you'll just... 
[54]Salty. 
[55]Christ, I don't even know you. I have no idea who you are. 
[56]Sorry to get you caught up in my soap opera. 
[57]You ever been married? 
[58]What happened? 
[59]And you didn't? No, I did, too.

[61]That was...I've never... We sent the payload to Livermore, and by measuring the cesium degradation, they've identified the reactor in Smerlensk that it came from. Washington has our birds tracking for that radiation signature in key cities. What do we know about the explosive? Our lab downstairs is still studying the C-4 sample. It's Czech, but we haven't nailed down the batch. 
[62]What the hell are you doing? 
[63]Well, you're not leaving till it's fixed, I'll tell you that. I'm afraid that could take a while.

[65]And what was the main staple of their diet? Trout.
